page.title: 19FARM & LANDSCAPE CHANGES 3
page.content: The rapid rise in car ownership has affected rural areas greatly: extra mobility eases shopping and{local {shops close}(no food shops in Thornwood or Epping Upland) and fewer footpaths are walked regularly.Most of the{footpaths have been ploughed}and the legal requirement to make them good ignored.Although legal rights of way,most are virtually abandoned,so farmers cannot be blamed for this.The survey group tried to follow one path through a rape field.A neighbour,asked advice,suggested a detour "And if he complains,say you were going to walk through his rape crop-he'll get the point." A few farms have been combined,making some of the houses redundant.These are open for new owners from larger towns. The decline in farm employment has also released former tied cottages.
